question: Discovered in 1930 by the amateur astronomer Clyde Tombaugh, Pluto was long known as the ninth planet of the solar system. ---- Therefore, Pluto’s status as a planet was reevaluated. According to this new definition, a planet must meet three criteria. First, it must orbit the sun. Second, it must have a sufficient mass that gravity shapes it into a spherical shape. question: (I) The clock is one of the first human creations in history because it fulfils the necessity to measure periods of time. (II) The earliest known geared clock was developed by the brilliant mathematician, scientist, and engineer Archimedes in the third century BCE. (III) He constructed an astronomical clock that was also a cuckoo clock, with birds that sang and moved on the hour. (IV) The need for accurate timekeeping for navigation was a big reason why clocks were made more precise and reliable. (V) The automatic continuing of the Archimedes clock was regulated by a system of floats in a water container with syphons and a system of four weights, counterweights, and strings.
